definitions.definition: The abnormal termination of operation of a superconducting magnet, occurring when part of the superconducting coil enters the normal (resistive) state.
A rapid change of the parameters of a physical system.
To satisfy, especially an actual or figurative thirst.
definitions.example: The library quenched her thirst for knowledge.

definitions.definition: To extinguish or put out (as a fire or light).
To cool rapidly by dipping into a bath of coolant, as a blacksmith quenching hot iron.
definitions.example: The swordsmith quenched the sword in an oil bath so that it wouldn't shatter.

definitions.definition: To terminate or greatly diminish (a chemical reaction) by destroying or deforming the remaining reagents.
To rapidly change the parameters of a physical system.
